result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin R Lesch

records.addlTxt:
11:13 AM Defendant Kevin R Lesch in court.  Attorney Brian P Dimmer in court for Kevin R Lesch.  Attorney Jacob Nelson Garman in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 

Parties are prepared to proceed with plea/sentencing today. 

State puts offer on the record. Defense confirms offer. 

Plea questionnaire filed. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant. 

Case 21CM1457
Plea - GUILTY
State consents to jury waiver. 
Agreement to use complaint for factual basis. 
BTC: GUILTY.
Parties give arguments as to sentencing. 

BTC: 60 days Racine County Jail imposed and stayed for 1 year of probation; If revoked, huber for employment. 

Conditions of Probation:
Absolute sobriety; 
No controlled substances;
No contact with victim A.S;  
Do not driver without a driver's license. 
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
Court Costs+ DNA surcharge.

BTC: 22CM289 is dismissed but read in.
Status conference on September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:15 AM Defendant Kevin R Lesch in court.  Attorney Brian P Dimmer in court for Kevin R Lesch.  Attorney Jacob Nelson Garman in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Defense is waiting on a global offer to resolve this matter. 
State puts offer on the record. 
BTC: Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

State's NOI to Intro Deft's Statements
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with the victim A.S (person, property, residence or family).

2:19 PM Prosecuting attorney Lucas P. Bennewitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kevin R Lesch in court.  Attorney Brian P Dimmer in court for Kevin R Lesch. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference on July 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.
